Description: Dominant module filters for such variants where the affected parent (Phenotype=3) and the affected individual (Phenotype=2) is heterozygous for the variant and unaffected individuals (Phenotype=1) are wild type for the alternate allele. In the absence of affected parent, the user can switch to case-specific module to filter for the heterozygous variants specific to the affected individual while the other unaffected individuals (Phenotype=1) are used as controls.

Parameters:

Maximum number of cases allowed to have missing genotype: The user can chose the number of affected individuals that can have missing genotype.

Maximum MAF in controls: Inaddition, the user can relax the criteria by allowing the variant to be present in controls by providing maximum minor allele frequency of the variants in the control cohort.

Required columns in PED file:

IndividualID and Phenotype columns are required to perform pedigree and case-control analysis

Phenotype coding:
0 exclude from the analysis
1 unaffected parent or off-spring or other unaffected individuals (controls)
2 affected off-spring (cases)
3 affected or carrier parent
